au.com.agic.apptesting.steps

Class WaitStepDefinitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.agic.apptesting.steps.WaitStepDefinitions

  • @Component
public class WaitStepDefinitions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains Gherkin steps that define wait conditions. These steps have Atom snipptets that start with the prefix "wait". See https://github.com/mcasperson/iridium-snippets for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • sleepStep

        @When(value="^I (?:wait|sleep) for \"(\\d+)\" second(?:s?)$")
public void sleepStep(java.lang.String sleepDuration)
        Pauses the execution of the test script for the given number of seconds
        Parameters:
        sleepDuration - The number of seconds to pause the script for

      • displaySimpleWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the)(?: element found by)?( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"(?: \\w+)*? to be displayed(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void displaySimpleWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to be displayed (i.e. to be visible) on the page.

        This is most useful when waiting for a page to load completely. You can use this step to pause the script until some known element is visible, which is a good indication that the page has loaded completely.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - include this text to continue the script in the event that the element can't be found

      • notDisplaySimpleWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the)(?: element found by)?( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"(?: \\w+)*? to not be displayed(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void notDisplaySimpleWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to not be displayed (i.e. to be visible) on the page.

        This is most useful when waiting for a page to load completely. You can use this step to pause the script until some known element is visible, which is a good indication that the page has loaded completely.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - include this text to continue the script in the event that the element can't be found

      • displayWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the) element with (?:a|an|the) (ID|class|xpath|name|css selector)( alias)? of \"([^\"]*)\" to be displayed(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void displayWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String selector,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to be displayed (i.e. to be visible) on the page.

        This is most useful when waiting for a page to load completely. You can use this step to pause the script until some known element is visible, which is a good indication that the page has loaded completely.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        selector - Either ID, class, xpath, name or css selector
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - include this text to continue the script in the event that the element can't be found

        ignoringTimeout - include this text to continue the script in the event that the element can't be found

      • clickWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the)(?: element found by)?( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"(?: \\w+)*? to be clickable(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void clickWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to be clickable on the page.

        This is most useful when waiting for an element to be in a state where it can be interacted with.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - include this text to continue the script in the event that the element can't be found

      • clickWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the) element with (?:a|an|the) (ID|class|xpath|name|css selector)( alias)? of \"([^\"]*)\" to be clickable(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void clickWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String selector,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String selectorValue,

        Waits the given amount of time for an element to be clickable on the page.

        This is most useful when waiting for an element to be in a state where it can be interacted with.

        Parameters:

        selector - Either ID, class, xpath, name or css selector
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.

      • presentSimpleWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the)(?: element found by)?( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"(?: \\w+)*? to be present(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void presentSimpleWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to be placed in the DOM. Note that the element does not have to be visible, just present in the HTML.

        This is most useful when waiting for a page to load completely. You can use this step to pause the script until some known element is visible, which is a good indication that the page has loaded completely.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - Include this text to ignore a timeout while waiting for the element to be present

      • notPresentSimpleWaitStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the)(?: element found by)?( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"(?: \\w+)*? to not be present(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void notPresentSimpleWaitStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element to not be placed in the DOM. Note that the element does not have to be visible, just present in the HTML.

        This is most useful when waiting for loading element in the page to be removed. You can use this step to pause the script until some known element is not longer visible.

        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - Include this text to ignore a timeout while waiting for the element to be present

      • presentLinkStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for a link with the text content of( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\" to be present(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void presentLinkStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String linkContent,
                                                                                                                                                                      java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for a link with the supplied text to be placed in the DOM. Note that the element does not have to be visible just present in the HTML.
        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the linkContent is found from the data set.
        linkContent - The text content of the link we are wait for
        ignoringTimeout - The presence of this text indicates that timeouts are ignored

      • notPresentLinkStep

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for a link with the text content of( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\" to not be present(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void notPresentLinkStep(java.lang.String waitDuration,

        ignoringTimeout - The presence of this text indicates that timeouts are ignored

      • displayAttrWait

        @When(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for (?:a|an|the) element with (?:a|an|the) attribute of \"([^\"]*)\" equal to( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\" to be displayed(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void displayAttrWait(java.lang.String waitDuration,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String attribute,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits the given amount of time for an element with the supplied attribute and attribute value to be displayed (i.e. to be visible) on the page.
        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        attribute - The attribute to use to select the element with
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        ignoringTimeout - Include this text to ignore a timeout while waiting for the element to be present

      • verifyPageContent

        @Then(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for the page to contain the text( alias)? \"(.*?)\"(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void verifyPageContent(java.lang.Integer wait,
                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String text,
                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String ignoreTimeout)
                                                                                                                                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits a period of time for the presence of some text on the page.
        Parameters:
        wait - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - This text appears if the text is actually an alias key
        text - The text to find on the page, or the alias to the text
        ignoreTimeout - If this text is present in the step, the step will silently fail if the requested page text could not be found
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread.sleep was interrupted

      • verifyPageRegexContent

        @Then(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for the page to contain the regex( alias)? \"(.*?)\"(,? ignoring timeouts?)?")
public void verifyPageRegexContent(java.lang.Integer wait,
                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String text,
                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String ignoreTimeout)
                                                                                                                                                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits a period of time for the presence of some text matching a regular expression on the page.
        Parameters:
        wait - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        alias - This text appears if the text is actually an alias key
        text - The text to find on the page, or the alias to the text
        ignoreTimeout - If this text is present in the step, the step will silently fail if the requested page regex could not be found
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread.sleep was interrupted

      • waitForAlert

        @Then(value="^I wait \"(\\d+)\" seconds for an alert to be displayed(,? ignoring timeouts?)?$")
public void waitForAlert(java.lang.Integer waitDuration,
                                                                                                                         java.lang.String ignoringTimeout)
        Waits a period of time for the presence of a alert.
        Parameters:
        waitDuration - The maximum amount of time to wait for
        ignoringTimeout - Include this string to ignore a timeout waiting for the alert
